squidpony.squidgrid.gui.swing.animation

Interface Animation

  • All Superinterfaces:
    java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.util.EventListener
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractAnimation, BumpAnimation, SlideAnimation, WiggleAnimation

    public interface Animation
extends java.awt.event.ActionListener
    Controls animations of images. Intended to be used with a Timer to activate the animation frames. The component for the animation must be set before the animation will function properly. All coordinates will be relative to the coordinate plane of the provided component.
    Author:
    Eben Howard - http://squidpony.com - howard@squidpony.com

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.awt.image.BufferedImage getImage()
      Returns the static image associated with this animation.
      java.awt.Point getLocation()
      Returns the coordinate of the top left corner of the animation.
      boolean isActive()
      Returns true if the component should continue to be allowed to animate.
      void remove()
      Removes this animation from the component it's in.
      void setComponent(javax.swing.JComponent component)
      Sets the Component in which this animation will take place.

      • Methods inherited from interface java.awt.event.ActionListener

        actionPerformed

    • Method Detail

      • isActive

        boolean isActive()
        Returns true if the component should continue to be allowed to animate. Animations on a loop will always return true so some outside mechanism must decide when to terminate them.
        Returns:

      • getImage

        java.awt.image.BufferedImage getImage()
        Returns the static image associated with this animation. Will typically be the ending image, but this may vary based on the animation style. This method is intended to be called when converting an animation into a static image.
        Returns:

      • setComponent

        void setComponent(javax.swing.JComponent component)
        Sets the Component in which this animation will take place. This must be set for the animation to function.
        Parameters:
        component -

      • remove

        void remove()
        Removes this animation from the component it's in.

      • getLocation

        java.awt.Point getLocation()
        Returns the coordinate of the top left corner of the animation.
        Returns:
